titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Time Inc. Corporate Administration Records
1853-1997
MS 3009-RG 5
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Holly Deakyne and Samantha Brown
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

p.date: Finding aid created June 2017, revised March 2018

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 13:58:21 -0400.

physdesc.extent: in 19 record cartons and 2 flat boxes

did.abstract: The General Files from the Corporate Administration Records include corporate-level records where the exact office of origination isn't known, or the files are from several people or offices at the corporate executive level, but were grouped together by Time Inc. at some point. Records include stock certificates, five-year plans, notary seals, patents, printing agreements, and organizational records from affiliates and subsidiaries.
did.physloc: These materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact manuscripts@nyhistory.org prior to your research visit to coordinate access. Keep in mind that it will take up to (5) business days for collections to arrive, and you should plan your research accordingly.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The General Files are organized into nine series:
Series I.B. General: Contract, Corporate, and Corporate Secretary Legal Files
Series I.H. General: Subsidiary Corporate Books
Series I.I. General: Time Warner Corporate Structure Books

eventgrp.event: Henry R. Luce / Briton Hadden (alternated as President and Treasurer)

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials may include privileged attorney correspondence and contracts and agreements. Materials created within the past 35 years also may be subject to restriction on a case-by-case basis. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Unreformatted audiovisual and digital material in the collection is not accessible.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: General Files were processed by Holly Deakyne and Samantha Brown from 2016 to 2018. Brown processed Stock, and Deakyne processed Contract, Corporate, and Corporate Secretary Legal Files; Dead Companies; Five-Year Plans; Notary Seals; Patents; Printing Agreements; Subsidiary Corporate Books; and Time Warner Corporate Structure Books. The original folders were retained when present although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding or transferred from hanging files. Order was imposed on all series except Dead Companies and Notary Seals. Deakyne created the inventory and other descriptive notes for this series.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The General Files from the Corporate Administration Records include corporate-level records where the exact office of origination isn't known, or the files are from several people or offices at the corporate executive level, but were grouped together by Time Inc. at some point. Records include stock certificates, five-year plans, notary seals, patents, printing agreements, and organizational records from affiliates and subsidiaries.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Further additions to this finding aid are expected.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Corporate Administration Records, MS 3009-RG 5, New-York Historical Society.

controlaccess.subject: Printing industry
Corporations -- New York (State) -- New York.
Corporations -- History
Publishers and publishing -- New York (State) -- New York.

physdesc.extent: in 4 record cartons and 2 flat boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Stock includes canceled Time Inc. stock certificates, stock split ledgers listing the stockholder, account number, and shares owned; and stock books from which certificates were written.

did.unittitle: Stock Certificates: 1933 September - 1934 June and Undated
Stock Books: March of the Years
Series I.B. General: Contract, Corporate, and Corporate Secretary Legal Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Contract, Corporate, and Corporate Secretary Legal Files are similar to the subseries Dead Companies, but were not included on the lists found with the transfer of Dead Companies to the Time Inc. Archives. These are a mix of files from defunct companies and old business arrangements made by Time Inc. and include acquisition and sale agreements, articles of incorporation and dissolution, meeting minutes, correspondence, publishing contracts, and title searches. The files come from Arnold Carlson as Controller (or Comptroller), John "Jack" Harvey as Comptroller, Peter Sheppe as Director of Administrative Services (Comptroller department), and Dean Chamberlain (business manager Time-Life International and then Corporate Circulation.) There are notes showing that some records are from the "Contract file"; files sent to Ronnie Biehl for the "Corp file"; and files from the "Corp Sec [Corporate Secretary] Legal file cabinet." Additional and more complete publishing agreements are in the subseries Printing Agreements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes records regarding Wilson H. Lee Company.

did.unittitle: Barges-N. L. Wallace and C. L. Stillman [RESTRICTED]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Regarding a Time Life International publishing agreement in Cuba.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes records regarding publishing Architectural Forum and Fortune.

did.unittitle: Hay, John I. Co. [John I. Hay Company] [RESTRICTED]
Lebanon Television Station (La Compagnie Libanaise de Television) [RESTRICTED]
Life's Picture History of World War II [RESTRICTED]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Contains purchase agreements of the Life humor magazine in order to obtain the rights to use the title "Life."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes trademark transfers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Include records relating to Michigan Square Building and Printing Developments, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Regarding the publishing of Architectural Forum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Regarding the publishing of Architectural Forum, and includes agreements with The Reader's Digest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes Architectural Forum 1932 Certificate of Incorporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Records and agreements regarding purchasing the publishing rights to Harry S. Truman's memoirs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Records and agreements regarding purchasing the publishing rights to his work about Douglas MacArthur.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes copyright registrations from several countries for articles written by the Duke of Windsor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Dead Companies contains a group of materials accompanied by a transfer list naming the companies included. Records include acquisition and sale agreements, operation agreements, certificates of incorporation and dissolution, articles of merger, correspondence, and other corporate documents. The files come from Charles Bear as Secretary, Barry Zorthian as Vice President, John "Jack" Harvey as Comptroller, and Peter Sheppe as Director of Administrative Services (Comptroller department). There is cross-over of company names with the subseries Subsidiary Corporate Books.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized alphabetically with lists of the companies at the front.

did.unittitle: East Texas Cable Television Services, Inc.
KLZ-AM and FM / Group One Broadcasting, Co.
Time-Life Cable TV of Michigan, Inc.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized alphabetically with the overview plan at the front.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Contains Five-Year Plans sent to a small group of corporate officers. Includes an overview and outlines of the strategic plans and plans for Books and Arts Associates, Fortune, Printing Developments Division, Real Estate Division, Selling Areas Marketing Plan (SAMI), Sports Illustrated, Time, Time-Life Films, Time-Life Records (music albums), and Time-life Video. Two copies originally belonged to Louis Banks, who was either Fortune's managing editor or the overall editorial director in 1971. It is not clear who ultimately collected and retained these plans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Notary Seals are a collection of seals from defunct Time Inc. affiliates and subsidiaries. The seals were used for embossing. There is cross-over of names with Dead Companies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: In original arrangement of individual alphabetical files followed by general files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Patents contains records of patents owned by Time Inc. and include patent applications and transfer of patent ownership. These patents were found housed together. Inventions covered include the mailing envelope, ink composition, casein techniques, paper coating, printing machine components and mechanisms, and chrome plating.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Printing Agreements contains bound agreements that detail the work to be done, the term, plant facilities, and equipment to be used. These agreements were found housed together. The majority of agreements relate to printing Life with one Fortune printing agreement from 1948. The printers are The Cuneo Press or R. R. Donnelley & Sons Company. Some covers are stamped with "Contract file." Similar, but not as complete, agreements are in the subseries Contract, Corporate, and Corporate Secretary Legal Files.

did.unittitle: Series I.H. General: Subsidiary Corporate Books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Subsidiary Corporate Books include bound volumes of business records of companies that were acquired by Time Inc. such as printers, paper mills, and radio or television stations. These volumes were housed together. Records include articles of incorporation, by-laws, and meeting minutes. There is cross-over of names with the subseries Dead Companies.

did.unittitle: East Texas Pulp and Paper Company
Rayburn Land Company / Rayburn Lodge and Marina Company / Rayburn Village Water Company
Series I.I. General: Time Warner Corporate Structure Books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Time Warner Corporate Structure Books contain information assembled by the Corporate Tax Department. Information includes lists of mergers, new subsidiaries, investments, and sales; lists of Time Warner and affiliated entities; lists of division names and trade names; and corporate structure trees of each entity, division, or subsidiary. Changes made since the last book are listed at the front.

did.unittitle: Subseries IV.A. Treasurer's Office Records: Treasurer J. Winston Fowlkes Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Subseries V.__. contains the records of J. Winston Fowlkes between 1971 and 1987. During this period, Fowlkes worked respectively as Assistant Treasurer, Treasurer, and Director of Investor Relations. The files focus on his contributions to the annual reports created for Time Inc., collaboration with pay television service Computer Television, Inc., and interactions and research on investments that interested Time Inc.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: From 1970 through 1978, J. Winston Fowlkes served as the Assistant Treasurer for Time Inc. In 1979, he was promoted to Treasurer. Fowlkes served as Treasurer until 1983 when he became Vice President and Director of Investor Relations within the __________________________________, a position in which he remained until 1986. Additionally, Fowlkes is listed as a member of Time Inc.'s 1984 and 1985 Annual Report Committees. Fowlkes resigned from Time Inc. in February 1987.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subsubseries: Subsubseries V.__.1. Annual Reports, Subsubseries V.__.2. Computer Television Inc., and Subsubseries V.__.3. Investor Relations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Annual Report files focus on J. Winston Fowlkes's work on the annual reports created for Time Inc. between 1984 and 1987. Included are annual reports, drafts of annual reports, annual report formatting proposals, schedules for production of the drafts of the annual report, annual meeting reports, briefing books, factbooks, correspondence and memos with information about accounting changes, press releases, invoices, divisional financial reports, year-end income results, resumes, photographs, transparencies, and slides.

did.unittitle: 1985: Annual Reports and Quarterlies of Other Companies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Computer Television Inc. (CTI) files contain J. Winston Fowlkes's files on his interactions with CTI. This subsubseries includes correspondence with Paul Klein and Austin Furst, reports related to CTI hardware test runs, analysis of the company, copies of CTI's certificates of incorporation, CTI board meeting agendas and minutes, and documents discussing CTI's collaboration with Hilton Hotels. Additionally, there are memoranda and correspondence from Rhett Austell, the Executive Vice President overseeing finances and administration and Time-Life Films.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Computer Television Inc. (CTI) was Time Inc.'s entry into a new business that focused on marketing movies for pay in hotels. Paul Klein served as President of CTI from 1971 to 1974. In 1974, Klein resigned as President and became chairman of the CTI board. Austin Furst, the former Senior Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of CTI, became the President following Klein. Furst later became the head Time-Life Films under the Video Group.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized alphabetically with general folders at the end.

did.unittitle: Hotel Movies: Correspondence, Statistics and Worksheets
Trans World Communications Inc.: Board Meetings
Trans World Communications Inc.: Board Meetings [RESTRICTED]
Trans World Communications: Sale to Rogers Cable
Trans World Communications: Sale to Rogers Cable [RESTRICTED]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Investor Relations files cover the period of 1977 to 1987 and focus on J. Winston Fowlkes's work as Director of Investor Relations and heading the committee handling the restructuring of Time Inc.'s agreement with the American Television and Communication Corporation. Combined with Fowlkes's documents, are documents created by Peter Uebelhoer and Thayer Bigelow, members of the restructuring committee.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Urban "Peter" Uebelhoer joined the corporate finance staff as Assistant Treasurer in October 1981 serving through 1983 under Treasurer J. Winston Fowlkes. From 1984 through 1986, Uebelhoer served as Treasurer and oversaw Cash Management and Fiduciary Investments.
Thayer Bigelow became Vice President and Treasurer of Time Inc. in 1982 and remained in this position for a year. From 1983 to 1987, he served as Chief Financial Officer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into two subsubsubseries: Subsubsubseries V.__.3.A. American Television and Communication Corporation, and Subsubsubseries V.__.3.B. Subject files.

did.unittitle: Subsubsubseries V.__.3.A. American Television and Communication Corporation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The American Television and Communication Corporation (ATC) files focus on the financial relationship between Time Inc. and ATC. The majority of documents deal with the restructuring of Time Inc. and ATC's financial relationship and the creation of an investor relations program. Included among the materials found in this subsubsubseries are memos and correspondence sent to the members of Time Inc.'s financial group, lists of investor relations consultants, financial restructuring proposals, lists of major institutional holders in cable companies, financial reports, clippings, press releases, security exchange committee reports, Q&As from research analysis meetings, common stock prospectuses, meeting schedules and outlines for conference, reports and printouts of presentations analyzing the finances of ATC, meeting itineraries, notes, and annual reports and financial reports of ATC.

did.unittitle: Preliminary Draft: Financial Statements and Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Subject files focus on companies in which Time Inc. invested in or were considering for investment. Materials include memos and correspondence sent to the members of Time Inc.'s financial group, requests for investments, financial reports of possible investments, agreements, and meeting schedules. Additionally, there are handwritten notes, newspaper clippings, press releases, annual reports, stock certificates, invoices, and transcripts of speeches.

did.unittitle: Bank Accounts/Relations: Stillman Memo to Board: 10/18/50
Tenth Annual Paine Webber Mitchell Hutchins Conference on the Outlook for the Media Program
Subseries IV.B. Treasurer's Office Records: Assistant Treasurer Allen Barr Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Allen Barr files include his files and files transferred to him by others working under him while he was both Assistant Treasurer of Time Inc. and Financial Planning Manager of the Magazine Group. The files look like part of alphabetically subject files (the S section) and chronological files regarding analysts meetings and annual reports. The Shareholders Correspondence is from Barbara Sangerman and contains shareholders' concerns how the Time Inc. offices in South Africa navigated apartheid and Time Inc.'s responses. Some of the 1987 Analysts Meeting files were transferred from Victor Sauerhoff. The Annual Reports records include distribution instructions, drafts and a proof copy, and proposals for changes. The Analysts Meeting records include attendee lists, reports, and presentation speeches and slide printouts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes one audiocassette.
1 audiocassette : analog, 1 5/16 ips, stereo ; 3 7/8 x 2 1/2 in., 1/8 in. tape. Label: "4/3/87 Analysts Meeting."
